original_title: Closing in on a PC enabled PSVR2
original_content:
When the PlayStation VR2 headset was released, people wondered whether it would be possible to get the headset to work as a PC VR headset. That would mean being able to plug it into a PC and have it work as a VR headset, instead of it only working on a PS5 as Sony intended.
Enthusiasts were initially skeptical and at times despondent about the prospects, but developer [iVRy]s efforts recently had a breakthrough. A PC-compatible VR2 is looking more likely to happen.
So far [iVRy] is claiming they have 6 DOF SLAM (Simultaneous Localisation and Mapping), Prox sensor, and stereo camera data.
Most of the juicy bits are paywalled behind [iVRy]s Patreon.  Were hoping the jailbreak process will eventually be open-sourced.
The PS VR2 headset is quite unlike a PC VR headset in a number of ways, and it has not been historically easy to work with Sonys products from a reverse-engineering perspective, whether its an attempt to improve the user experience of an annoying headset, or an attempt to understand the not-even-remotely-sanely-designed protocols behind the Sony Memory Stick. Getting the PS VR2 headset to work in a way it wasnt intended was expected to be an uphill battle.
Its not a finished job, but judging by the progress regularly shared on [iVRy]s Twitter account, it might only be a matter of time.
title: PlayStation VR2ヘッドセットをPCのVRヘッドセットとして使用する方法に着実な進展
body: PS VR2がPCで動作する可能性が実現しつつある。6 DOF SLAM、Proxセンサー、ステレオカメラのデータが利用可能。進展がTwitterで共有されているが、まだ完成ではない。
titles: PlayStation VR2ヘッドセットをPCのVRヘッドセットとして使用する方法に着実な進展
[iVRy]の取り組みにより、PC互換のVR2が実現可能に
[iVRy]がPC対応のVR2に6 DOF SLAM、Proxセンサー、ステレオカメラデータを統合
[iVRy]のPatreonには詳細が多数掲載されており、ジェイルブレイクプロセスのオープンソース化を期待
PS VR2ヘッドセットの逆向きエンジニアリングは困難を伴いましたが、進展が見られる
